metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2233 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the inbound_cap_ls function incommon/inbound.c in HexChat 2.10.2 allows remote IRC servers to cause adenial of service (crash) via a large number of options in a CAP LSmessage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hexchat - 2.12.4-1
hexchat-common - 2.12.4-1
hexchat-lua - 2.12.4-1
hexchat-perl - 2.12.4-1
hexchat-plugins - 2.12.4-1
hexchat-python3 - 2.12.4-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: hexchat package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.4-1').
